intro: Diosma laxa, commonly known as the slender diosma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Diosma laxa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is a perennial herb that is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
